Description: Stamp (vessel): qisṭ. Six line Kufic inscription visible. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: Stamps of Yazīd II together with Ḥayyān b. Shurayḥ are well known and have long been correctly identified, but there is no parallel to the present piece on which Yazid is joined by Usāma. Only part of the name survives and that of the father is missing, but the restoration seems certain and confirms those literary sources which say that Usāma was appointed Finance Director of Egypt a second time in the Caliphate of Yazīd.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (26)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Abu Khalid Yazid II ibn 'Abd al-Malik
Named in inscription: Usāma b. Zayd
